channel.title: Morning Money
channel.description: Delivered daily by 8 a.m., Morning Money examines the latest news in finance, politics and policy — and on Fridays, Morning Money: Capital Risk highlights the downstream effects on markets.

item.title: Meet Kevin Warsh
item.description: Warsh’s evolution from crisis-era inflation hawk to Trump ally has been headscratching for some Fed watchers, and some are “wondering which version of Warsh will ultimately govern the central bank.”
item.dc:creator: By Sam Sutton

item.title: Wall Street draws a line on AI
item.description: AI has become an engine of the S&P 500, a central pillar of the U.S. economy and a core part of President Donald Trump’s economic agenda.
item.dc:creator: By Yasmin Khorram

item.title: Why Warsh might not give Trump the economy he wants
item.description: President Donald Trump’s pick to lead the Federal Reserve would inherit a healthy economy that most Americans believe is about to skid.
item.dc:creator: By Sam Sutton

item.title: Another crypto divide simmers on Capitol Hill
item.description: A fracture is emerging within the cryptocurrency industry over how to decipher part of a sweeping digital assets bill.
item.dc:creator: By Declan Harty

item.title: Wall Street has already moved on from Jerome Powell
item.description: Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell has simultaneously become one of the most and least interesting people in the news.
item.dc:creator: By Victoria Guida and Sam Sutton
item.dc:contributor: By Victoria Guida and Sam Sutton

item.title: The fuzzy math on Trump’s investment pledges
item.description: The pledges that Trump squeezed from allies like the European Union, Japan and South Korea total more than $5 trillion over the next decade.
item.dc:creator: By Sam Sutton

item.title: The coming transformation in bank rules
item.description: Treasury Undersecretary for Domestic Finance Jonathan McKernan said that his department is seeking a “fundamental reset of financial regulation.”
item.dc:creator: By Aiden Reiter and Victoria Guida
item.dc:contributor: By Aiden Reiter and Victoria Guida

item.title: Republicans’ awkward affordability politics
item.description: President Donald Trump’s push to lower costs is putting his allies on Capitol Hill in a bind.
item.dc:creator: By Jasper Goodman

item.title: How Greenland and housing affordability are linked
item.description: The fraying of alliances that underpin much of the modern global economy was a big deal for markets.
item.dc:creator: By Sam Sutton and Victoria Guida
item.dc:contributor: By Sam Sutton and Victoria Guida

item.title: The long and winding road to housing legislation
item.description: Congressional Republicans are searching for a winning housing policy this election year as the issue of affordability dominates voters’ concerns.
item.dc:creator: By Katherine Hapgood

item.title: The Trump-Wall Street honeymoon is over, as risks mount
item.description: Tensions are mounting between the White House and America’s finance giants.
item.dc:creator: By Aiden Reiter

item.title: What Trump’s clash with Powell means for Kevin Hassett
item.description: The administration’s latest attacks on Powell are rekindling fears that the White House is trying to exert undue influence on the central bank.
item.dc:creator: By Sam Sutton

item.title: It’s not just about Powell
item.description: The consequences of the latest skirmish between Trump and Powell will be more lasting than a single trading session.
item.dc:creator: By Sam Sutton

item.title: A Wall Street regulator’s prediction market puzzle
item.description: Wall Street’s newest regulator is about to enter his fourth week on the job, and already, he’s staring down a swelling political headache: what to do about prediction markets.
item.dc:creator: By Declan Harty and Sam Sutton
item.dc:contributor: By Declan Harty and Sam Sutton

item.title: Trump’s new boogeyman: Wall Street
item.description: As economic anxiety drags down Donald Trump's approval ratings, the president is now back to a tried-and-true playbook.
item.dc:creator: By Sam Sutton and Declan Harty
item.dc:contributor: By Sam Sutton and Declan Harty

item.title: The Catch-22 of Trump’s tax refunds
item.description: The One Big Beautiful Bill Act is key to President Donald Trump’s economic agenda.
item.dc:creator: By Sam Sutton

item.title: Bank CEOs are going to the mattresses over crypto
item.description: K Street lobbyists for banks and cryptocurrency companies have been brawling for months over a landmark bill that would overhaul how digital assets are regulated.
item.dc:creator: By Jasper Goodman and Sam Sutton
item.dc:contributor: By Jasper Goodman and Sam Sutton

item.title: What we talk about when we talk about affordability
item.description: Anyone in politics can tell you that “affordability” is primed to be the number one issue on voters’ minds as we head into the 2026 midterms.
item.dc:creator: By Sam Sutton

item.title: It’s good to be rich
item.description: President Donald Trump swept into office promising a golden age.
item.dc:creator: By Sam Sutton

item.title: The ‘unsettling phenomenon’ hitting Trump’s economy
item.description: A growing economy is a good thing. Politically speaking, it may not mean much moving forward.
item.dc:creator: By Sam Sutton

item.title: How gutting the CFPB clashes with affordability concerns
item.dc:creator: By Aiden Reiter

item.title: Tech leaders cheered Trump’s AI order. Now they’re worried about what comes next.
item.description: President Donald Trump’s executive order limiting states’ ability to write their own AI regulations has caused a new wave of uncertainty.
item.dc:creator: By Yasmin Khorram

item.title: Knives out for Kevin Hassett
item.dc:creator: By Sam Sutton

item.title: The structural forces hitting Trump’s labor market
item.description: Further deterioration of the labor market would deepen the political challenges Trump faces with voters who are increasingly dissatisfied with his economic stewardship.
item.dc:creator: By Sam Sutton and Victoria Guida
item.dc:contributor: By Sam Sutton and Victoria Guida

item.title: French Hill looks to 2026
item.dc:creator: By Jasper Goodman

item.title: Porn has a debanking problem
item.description: Many advocates were caught off guard by the OCC’s explicit nod to the woes of adult entertainers who say they’ve been cut off by their banks and payment providers.
item.dc:creator: By Sam Sutton

item.title: Trump boxes in his next Fed chair
item.description: The hits keep coming for President Donald Trump’s future nominee to head the Federal Reserve board.
item.dc:creator: By Victoria Guida

item.title: The SEC’s last Democrat speaks out
item.description: Wall Street’s top regulator is laying the groundwork for a potentially massive upheaval to the rules governing finance.
item.dc:creator: By Declan Harty

item.title: Trump calls it ‘woke.’ Senate Republicans say CDFI Fund is essential.
item.description: The Trump administration’s repeated efforts to kill the Community Development Financial Institutions Fund have run into a surprising roadblock.
item.dc:creator: By Katherine Hapgood and Sam Sutton
item.dc:contributor: By Katherine Hapgood and Sam Sutton
